alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 29 at 8:55PM MDT until April 30 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT TONIGHT FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Winds remain elevated, although down from their earlier peaks, and relative humidities remain abysmally low across the forecast area. This will warrant an extension of the Red Flag Warning to midnight tonight. After a break from the winds on Saturday, southwesterly winds will strengthen again on Sunday. Combined with exceptionally dry conditions and an unstable atmosphere, critical fire weather conditions will return for all areas again on Sunday. ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...All of northern and central New Mexico until midnight tonight. All of northern and central New Mexico again late Sunday morning through Sunday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...For tonight, west to northwest 15 to 30 mph with gusts between 25 and 35 mph, except out of the north 15 to 20 mph with brief gusts 20 to 30 mph for the Northeast Plains. The highest winds will be found along the central mountain chain and the highlands to the east. For Sunday, southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...For tonight, between 4 and 15 percent. For Sunday, between 4 and 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Outdoor burning should not be done. Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
